learning_outcomes.description: read a range of passages in Ancient Greek containing the parts of speech and syntax covered in the JACT Reading Greek course.
translate into good English a range of passages covered in the JACT Reading Greek course and extracts from related authors outside of the JACT textbook.
recognise and classify a range of different parts of speech.
parse (give the grammatical properties of) various parts of speech covered in the JACT Reading Greek course.
appreciate some of the distinctive features of the studied authors in their historical and social context.

assessments.due_date:
Homework Assignment 1 7/08/2025 2:00 pm

Homework Assignment 2 14/08/2025 2:00 pm

Homework Assignment 3 21/08/2025 2:00 pm

Homework Assignment 4 28/08/2025 2:00 pm

Homework Assignment 5 16/10/2025 2:00 pm

Please upload your homework by 2pm Thursday in the assigned weeks OR hand in your homework in class at 4pm Thursday in the assigned weeks
assessments.task_description:
Homework Assignment 1: Reading Greek Grammar and Exercises based on 16C-E

Homework Assignment 2: Reading Greek Grammar and Exercises based on 16F-H

Homework Assignment 3: Reading Greek Grammar and Exercises based on 17A-B

Homework Assignment 4: Reading Greek Grammar and Exercises based on 17C-E

Homework Assignment 5: Scansion Exercise (Homeric Hexameter) 


All five (5) assignments must be completed with a genuine attempt for each question

***Marking criteria and/or marking rubrics are available in the ‘Assessment’ folder in Blackboard for this course.

Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Machine Translation (MT) are emerging tools that may support students in completing this assessment task. Students may appropriately use AI and/or MT in completing this assessment task. Students must clearly reference any use of AI or MT in each instance.

A failure to reference generative AI or MT use may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.
assessments.submission_guidelines: Please submit your completed homework assignment through the appropriate submission link on Blackboard.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.due_date:
8/09/2025 4:00 pm

exam will be held in class 4pm-5pm Monday 8 September 2025
assessments.task_description:
Translation and grammatical analysis of passages selected from the JACT Reading Greek course 16C-18E


***Marking criteria and/or marking rubrics are available in the ‘Assessment’ folder in Blackboard for this course

This assessment task evaluates student’s abilities, skills and knowledge without the aid of Artificial Intelligence (AI). Students are advised that the use of AI technologies to develop responses is strictly prohibited and may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.
assessments.submission_guidelines: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.task_description:
The Final Exam will contain accidence, grammatical, translation and comprehension questions, drawn from the whole course.

It will ask students to translate Seen and Unseen passages of Greek to English, answer grammatical and comprehension questions, and to complete a scansion exercise.


This assessment task evaluates student’s abilities, skills and knowledge without the aid of Artificial Intelligence (AI). Students are advised that the use of AI technologies to develop responses is strictly prohibited and may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.
assessments.submission_guidelines: You may be able to defer this exam.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to defer this exam.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to defer this exam.

learning_activities.topic:
Reading Greek Homer passage and revision

Extra passage from Homer's Iliad or Odyssey will be provided for translation and scansion. We will also revise the key grammar from the course.

Learning outcomes: L01, L02, L03, L04, L05
